title: Store decoded AIS messages in SQLite
description:
Create db/decoder.py - a separate service that:
- Polls raw_messages WHERE decoded=0 ORDER BY id
- Decodes using pyais with full error handling
- Routes to positions/vessels/base_stations/nav_aids by msg type
- On success: SET decoded=1
- On error: SET decoded=-1, decode_error='...'
- Handles multi-part messages with timeout
- Can run continuously or one-shot for backfill

CRITICAL: Capture (ais-catcher.py) stays simple - raw_messages is a queue that never fails. Decode bugs don't lose data.
close_reason: Created db/decoder.py - processes 25k msg/sec. Decoded 109k messages: 65k positions, 101 vessels, 2.9k base stations, 15k nav aids. Ruby Princess has 18k track points.

title: Fix voyage segment calculation - must be between port stops
description: WRONG: Currently treating destination field as voyage, placing one callout in dumb location. CORRECT: A voyage is all track points BETWEEN any two port stops. Ruby Princess has multiple voyages in track history. Each segment between stops is a voyage.
close_reason: Voyages now correctly calculated as track segments between port stops. Shows 5 voyages for Ruby Princess: Start→Hilo, Hilo→Honolulu, Honolulu→Kahului, Kahului→Nawiliwili, Nawiliwili→In progress

title: Highlight vessel destination on map
close_reason: Added PORTS database and lookupDestinationPort(). When vessel selected, draws route line + marker + label to destination port.

title: Click away from vessel to deselect
close_reason: Vessel tracking mode implemented - full track on select, click-to-deselect on map

title: Configurable graphs selection in settings
close_reason: Configurable graphs implemented via settings.charts with applySettings() toggling chart visibility

title: Grammar error: '1 vessels' should be '1 vessel' - pluralization fix in stats display
close_reason: Fixed quick bugs: zoom reset, track updates, pluralization

title: Remove history dropdown widget
close_reason: History dropdown removed as part of timeline slider implementation

title: Vessels tab not filtering by timeline/age cutoff - shows all vessels instead of visible ones
description: The vessels table shows all vessels regardless of timeline position or vessel age cutoff setting. It should only show vessels that are currently visible on the map (filtered by the same state). This is a symptom of inconsistent state derivation - the map filters vessels but the table doesn't use the same filtered data.
close_reason: Signals refactor complete. Vessel table now uses filteredVessels computed signal which properly filters by timeline/age cutoff.

title: Backend: Add port stops and voyage segments to track API
description: Extend track API to include detected port stops and voyage segments. Port stops come from stationary period detection. Voyage segments are groups of track points with the same destination field.
close_reason: Added include_analysis parameter to track API. Returns port_stops with locode, name, country, region, lat/lon, arrival/departure times, duration. Returns voyage_segments with destination port info, duration, avg speed, point count, midpoint coords.

close_reason: Port stop and voyage segment markers implemented and tested - both marker types display correctly when Names toggle is active

title: Add polygon callout lines to reduce visual clutter
description: Challenge: deck.gl TextLayer uses pixel offsets (screen space), but LineLayer uses geographic coordinates (world space). True callout lines require either: (1) custom layer rendering in screen space, or (2) viewport-dependent coordinate conversion. Current implementation offsets labels via pixels, which reduces clutter but doesn't show visible leader lines. May need to accept current approach or implement custom rendering.
close_reason: Implemented CSS-based callout lines with leader lines (::before) and anchor dots (::after) for voyage/port markers. Visual clarity improved with line connecting label to geographic point.

- vessels table: Type 5,24 static data (UPSERT)
- base_stations: Type 4,11
- nav_aids: Type 21
- latest_positions: trigger-maintained, one row per vessel
- Add decoded/decode_error columns to raw_messages
- Triggers: update_latest_position, update_latest_vessel_static

Target: SELECT * FROM latest_positions in <10ms
close_reason: Created db/migrate.py with schema, indexes, and triggers. Verified working.

title: Support offline-first edge deployment
description:
Support offline-first edge deployment:
- Use free tile providers (CARTO, OpenFreeMap, Protomaps) - no API keys
- Cache tiles on demand to local disk
- Go proxy endpoint for server-side tile caching (works across browser sessions)
- Cache fonts/sprites for vector tile styles
- Assumes some internet connectivity at some point (no bundled tiles)

title: Implement SQLite polling loop
description: Background task that polls raw_messages table for new rows using cursor-based pagination
close_reason: Implemented in main.py poll_database()

title: Refactor to @preact/signals-core for reactive state management
description:
Current state management is ad-hoc with manual update calls scattered throughout the codebase. Refactor to use @preact/signals-core for proper reactive state:

- signal() for core state (vessels, tracks, selectedMmsi, filters, timelinePosition)
- computed() for derived state (filteredVessels, selectedVessel, selectedTrack)  
- effect() for side effects (deck.gl layers, Tabulator, uPlot charts, DOM updates)
- batch() for WebSocket message batching

Benefits:
- Single source of truth for filtered vessels (map, table, stats all derive from same computed)
- Automatic dependency tracking (no manual update calls)
- ~1.5KB gzipped, CDN-loadable
- Cleaner separation of state vs. view logic

Key signals:
- vessels: Map<mmsi, vessel>
- tracks: Map<mmsi, position[]>
- selectedMmsi: number | null
- timelinePosition: number (0-100)
- settings: {vesselAgeCutoff, showVesselNames, charts}

Key computed:
- filteredVessels: vessels filtered by timeline/age cutoff
- visibleVesselCount: filteredVessels.length
- selectedVessel: vessels.get(selectedMmsi)
- selectedTrack: tracks.get(selectedMmsi)
close_reason: Signals refactor complete. Vessel table now uses filteredVessels computed signal which properly filters by timeline/age cutoff.

title: Set up MapLibre GL JS base map
description: Initialize MapLibre map with default style, pan/zoom controls
close_reason: Implemented in static/app.js initMap()

title: Rewrite ais-princess as single Go binary
description:
Replace Python services with a single Go binary that can run in multiple modes:
- receiver: AIS-catcher + SQLite persist + NATS publish
- server: API + WebSocket + decoder + web UI
- standalone: full stack for offline operation

Key architectural decisions:
- Embedded NATS JetStream for messaging (local + remote sync)
- SQLite for all persistence (edge and cloud)
- NATS topics for real-time (no polling)
- Leaf node to fly.io cloud when online

description: index.html with MapLibre GL JS, deck.gl, Tabulator loaded via CDN script tags. Two-panel layout.
close_reason: Implemented in static/index.html

title: Convert scripts to uv tool entrypoints using root dependencies
description: Scripts (main.py, ais-catcher.py) currently use inline PEP 723 script dependencies. Convert to proper Python modules using root pyproject.toml dependencies. Add [project.scripts] entrypoints so they can run as 'uv run ais-web' and 'uv run ais-capture' etc.

close_reason: Implemented in static/app.js addTrackPoint()

title: Decoder dropping 13% of messages - binary types 6,8,25,26 and safety messages not stored
description:
## Problem
decoder.py is NOT storing:
- Type 6, 8, 25, 26 binary messages (13,278 messages = 13% of data)
- Type 12, 14 safety messages
- Type 19 static data (shipname, ship_type) not extracted to vessels table

## DAC/FID data being lost
- DAC 366, FID 56: 2,311 US Coast Guard environmental messages
- Type 26 multi-slot binary: 10,960 messages

## dac-fid-decoder module exists but unused
The dac-fid-decoder/ module was built to decode binary payloads but decoder.py doesn't use it.

## Fix required
1. Create binary_messages table for Type 6, 8, 25, 26
2. Store DAC, FID, raw payload, decoded fields
3. Integrate dac-fid-decoder for payload decoding
4. Extract Type 19 static data to vessels table
5. Create safety_messages table for Type 12, 14
6. Add missing fields to positions table (maneuver, second, radio)
close_reason: Fixed: binary_messages (13,611) and safety_messages (4) now stored. Type 19 static data extracted. 100% decode success rate.

title: Integrate dac-fid-decoder for binary AIS messages (Types 6, 8, 25, 26)
description:
## Problem
decoder.py extracts DAC/FID from binary messages but:
1. Doesn't store them in database
2. Doesn't use dac-fid-decoder module to decode payloads

## dac-fid-decoder module status (already implemented)
- DAC 001: IMO international (Met/Hydro, Area Notice, etc.)
- DAC 200: Inland waterways (EU rivers)
- DAC 366/367: US NOAA/USCG (Area Notice, Environmental Reports)

## Data being lost
- Type 8 DAC 367 FID 33: NOAA weather buoy data
- Type 8 DAC 001/367 FID 22: Area notices, danger zones
- Type 26: Multi-slot binary (10,960 messages!)

## Fix Required
1. Create binary_messages table (mmsi, timestamp, msg_type, dac, fid, raw_payload, decoded_json)
2. Call dac-fid-decoder to decode payloads
3. Store decoded environmental/weather data
4. Expose via API for frontend display
close_reason: Completed as part of ais-princess-h10 decoder fix

title: Restyle markers with iOS-quality color palette
description: Current green/blue text markers are ugly. Research proper color palettes. Aim for iOS-quality visual design - subtle, professional colors that work with dark theme.

title: Extract Type 19 (Extended Class B) static data to vessels table
description:
## Problem
Type 19 messages contain static vessel data (shipname, ship_type, dimensions) but decoder.py only stores them as positions.

## Impact
Class B vessels transmitting Type 19 don't have their names/types recorded in vessels table.

## Fields in Type 19 that should go to vessels
- shipname
- ship_type
- to_bow, to_stern, to_port, to_starboard
- epfd

## Fix
Update decoder._store_position() to also upsert vessels table when msg_type == 19
close_reason: Completed as part of ais-princess-h10 decoder fix

title: latest_positions missing draught and ETA fields from vessels table
description:
## Problem
The latest_positions table is missing:
- draught (REAL)
- eta_month, eta_day, eta_hour, eta_minute (INTEGER)

These fields exist in vessels table but aren't copied to latest_positions by triggers.

## Impact
- Draught graph is empty (no draught data reaching frontend)
- ETA display is broken (no ETA data reaching frontend)

## Fix Required
1. Add columns to latest_positions table
2. Update trigger update_latest_position to include these fields
3. Update triggers update_latest_vessel_insert/update to sync these fields
4. Run migration with --force to recreate tables
close_reason: Fixed: Added draught, eta_month, eta_day, eta_hour, eta_minute to latest_positions table and triggers. Re-decoded all messages.

title: Track layer shows full history - vessel tracks should always display complete historical path, not just recent points
